title: About
text:
I want to understand the world. Many people try to answer empirical questions with non-empirical evidence. I want to change that. I work with Dr. Brian Patterson to research the effects of informatics-based interventions in the emergency department on patient outcomes, especially falls and cognitive impairment screenings.

Research Interests

EHR Phenotyping
Causal Inference
Real World Data
Replication of findings in Real World Data

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Work Experience

Data Scientist, Berbee-Walsh Department of Emergency Medicine (Madison, WI) | Sep 2019 - Present

University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
Translating physician ideas into EHR phenotypes and quantifiable metrics
Working Dr. Brian Patterson to evaluate the effectiveness of a community falls prevention program
I work with operational leadership to monitor patient volumes and throughput, quantify outcomes of quality improvement initiatives, evaluate physician growth and opportunities for improvement with quantitative data, and generally run the numbers for all questions leadership has.

SQL Database Administrator, Epic Hosting (Verona, WI) | Nov 2017 - Aug 2019

I worked as a database administrator for Epic’s hosted division, supporting dozens of servers across multiple customer clusters.
I automated maintenance processes and best practice configurations with Puppet.

Technical Services Engineer, Epic (Verona, WI) | Aug 2010 - Nov 2017

I was a technical services engineer (TS) for Epic’s Hospital Billing software, where I …

was a subject matter expert for all things revenue capture.
was a prolific coder.
was awarded “TS of the Year” after being nominated by my peers.
supported dozens of domestic go-lives and multiple international go-lives.
